comment: I took Dr. Hutchins for the Oscars section of the class. Assignments made sense and were straightforward. Grading criteria was clear. She was very willing to accommodate due date requests when I had personal circumstances come up. Overall, I had a great experience!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: If you have the chance to take Dr. Hutchins please do so! I enjoyed her curriculum mainly because you build upon your own portfolio by focusing on projects and writing pieces for fashion brands or magazines. All in all this class was very clear with scheduling and instruction and also included very enjoyable content.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Hutchins is amazing. I had her for Fashion x Media, and the entire class was essentially based on projects to help build your professional portfolio. This is a heavy writing class; I found myself writing 3-page papers a week, but the work did not seem like work; the projects were fun. I would take this class over again twice!

Professor Hutchins was a great professor! She gave really awesome feedback and set up her class so well. There were no quizzes or tests, only assignments and discussion posts. It moves fast since it is only a 7 week course but basically there is just an assignment and DP due each week. Very manageable.

I really enjoyed this short class about social media. Her personality really showed through her announcements and was easily accessible by email. Her assignments are very easy to understand and she is very knowledgeable on this subject.

She seems really sweet, but I didn't get much from this. She only really focuses on Twitter as a social media column, but then requires several social media focuses on the final project. Not my favorite.

This was the second class I took with Dr. Hutchins and I loved it! The assignments are practical applications of work you'll be doing in the field. She's very knowledgeable and offers first-hand insight so you really understand what is expected of you. The work is not too challenging if you clearly read the instructions and put in effort. Take her!

Several assignments throughout the semester make up your grade. They're all easy enough, but DEFINITELY time-consuming. The class honestly wasn't as fun as I thought it would be, but I learned some things so there's that. Attendance is mandatory. There's no book. Hybrid, but feels more like a once a week class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took Dr. Hutchins for special topics in PR during June-mester. I absolutely loved her class and her style of teaching.  I am not easily intrigued by school-related topics,if we're being totally honest, but she made the class exciting and I looked forward to going. She makes your work for your grades, but so what. I definitely recommend her!

Dr. Hutchins is a wonderful teacher. She is very passionate about what she is teaching and has great insight into pr work. She is a difficult grader but if you take the feedback she gives you the first time to heart it will make you a much better writer.

Dr. Hutchins is intimidating at first. Very strict. Comes across as rude in the beginning but ended up being helpful throughout the semester. Sticks to deadlines. The media kit for a real non-profit requires a ton of work/ 6-10 pieces of writing but that is the final. Quizes aren't too difficult.  She knows a lot about PR. Overall tough class.

I liked Hutchins in the beginning of the semester, she seemed cool and fair and she is to a certain extent. However, I ultimately feel like my writing skills have not improved. Her focus the entire semester is the media kit. I wish we had more feedback on our written pieces; writing "ehh..." on my paper doesn't tell me anything.

If I could, I would not have taken this class with her. After all was said and done, I still didn't learn much about the writing aspect of PR. The main focus of this class was the media kit, which was seriously too much work to be done alone.

i can't believe prof hutchins has any low ratings. she is a wonderful teacher! she is considerate, fair, and always willing to help her students!if you do your work- you will do well! my favorite teacher @ ksu so far!

I think she grades somewhat arbitrarily and unfairly.  She seems to like the younger students over the adults.  I didn't like having the information dolled out to me in pieces.  I would rather have the big picture presented first, then delve into the details. She was very knowledgeable, but taught more at a freshman level than upper division.
She loves what she teaches. She has a lot of background with PR.  Very helpful if you ever have questions.  I would take any class she teaches.
